snippet: The selection of Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, who did not appear on various preconclave lists of likely popes, seemed to confirm that old line about papal selection: go in a pope, come out a cardinal.
abstract: The selection of Cardinal Jorge Mario Bergoglio, who did not appear on various preconclave lists of likely popes, seemed to confirm that old line about papal selection: go in a pope, come out a cardinal.

headline.main: In Papal Elections, Are Long Shots the Rule?
